page.title: 02THE RIVER BRAY
page.content: The{River Bray}flows in a North/South direction through the eastern part of this area. It rises on{Exmoor}and flows into the{River Mole}at the very south of our area. it is not a very big river. It is only about 5 metres across. It is not very deep. There are fields on each side of the river for cattle and sheep. One field has potatoes growing in it this year. There is one mill on the river at {Clapworthy.}It used to be a grain mill. Then it became a cider mill. It is still a cider mill but they don't use the water to turn the mill wheel. There used to be another mill at Bray Bridge. There are two roads going over the river. One carries the main road to Exeter from South Molton. The other carries the Torrington road from South Molton. We live off this road.
